comment: tests are very difficult but the lectures and homework questions don't match the tests at all. not worth going to class imo. only thing that saves your grade is he makes an outline before each test saying what you have to know, and you can have a sheet of paper full of notes.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Does not follow the syllabus. Tests are extremely difficult, even though the are on D2L. I am a 4.0 student with all As and I flunked the final and probably sold my gpa. I would not recommend this professor for any class as because he is impossible to get ahold of and is unorganized.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment:
Prof is very knowledgeable and kind but lectures are monotonous and most of the class skips. Lots of stories. Posts class notes and outlines on D2L. No tests except final. Struggles with posting quizzes/cases on time and posting grades on D2L. 

Quizzes are 50%
Cases are 10%
SB are 20%
Final is 20%

Clements was an OK professor. His lectures were incredibly boring to the point where I just stopped attending class. Grade consisted of smartbooks, some easy case studies, the occasional online quiz, and the final. If you want a relatively easy class, take this. Just know that this professor has the personality of tap water.

Go ahead and shred the syllabus. Forget the schedule. He does what he wants, when he wants. NO written communication. Pushes material and opens quizzes weeks later. Drags lectures unnecessarily. He takes forever to cover material so if you HAVE to take is professor, save yourself some time and just read the textbook. His tests were typo central.

Tests and quizzes were sometimes scenarios or true/false but all were open-note. His lectures are entertaining and he is really knowledgeable about the content and has lots of personal experience with most of the content. By far my favorite class this semester.
Professor does not respond to emails. He posts assignments late.

This professor the latter half of the semester failed to respond to emails. He also did not post tests, and struggled with communication. Do not recommend because the anxiety of my grade due to his lack of preparation is not it.

Very poor instruction on assignments and project. Had to CC school director to receive email reply.
Limited learning could obtain from lectures.

Summer Sem. Open book, Research quiz instead of project (not easy). Didn't help that he didn't open it till the very end of the semester. Grades consist of 3 tests & a final (drop one of the 3 test) 65% of your grade. 10% research project, 10% SB, 15% quizzes. Don't expect to see your test grades till a day after or more & sometimes other grades.

Read from slides the entire time. The lectures were super boring. I figured out it was better to work the practice problems instead of coming to class. Grades are based on 3 exams (drop 1) & a final (80% of your grade) 10% SB, 10%quizzes. (drop lowest quiz & SB) Overall not a terrible professor get ready to put some effort in. Also open book.

The lectures were pretty boring and not engaging. However, he is very understanding and he will extend things If needed and curve your grade up tons if he can tell you really try. Only had one in person exam. The rest, including the final, were on D2L with no lockdown browser. Overall, not bad at all.

This is a difficult class and if you want an A be ready to put in the work. You are graded by four things. Your best two exams of three (50% of grade), a tax research project (10%), a tax return project (10%), and the final (30%). The final is not cumulative. He is very knowledgeable and always willing to answer questions in class.
Tests and quizzes are somewhat difficult but are usually open note. He is very nice and caring but it is somewhat hard to get responses from him outside class.

Dr. Clements is a very nice guy, and he will be happy to talk about almost anything. The one major problem I had with him was responding to emails. I sent him a few emails over the semester and if he responded at all it took a very long time. Other people in the class have said the same. Overall its a mid class that you wont have trouble passing.

From what I heard from other classmates, he never seemed to respond to emails. I never reached out to him personally, but his class was very straight forward. Only quizzes, tests, and smart books so it wasn't too bad. The only thing was he would always post quizzes and tests late so we never knew when we needed to complete our assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: FYI Bruce & Alan are the same guy. His online lecture style was not for me. He kind of does live problems, but they are largely already typed out when he goes over them, so it can be hard to understand his thought process & specific math unless you ask. Each of the 3 tests is 30% of the grade, but it was open note, open book, so that is helpful.

I would give this professor a 1, but I still received an A so I bumped it up 1. For starters this professor contacted a total of maybe three times the entire semester. He was also impossible to reach and my class had to go to the head of the department multiple times to finally reach him. Class isn't insanely hard but the professor really ruined it

Very respected teacher. Even when he was disrespected in class, he kept it very professional, as well as he addressed everything the student was discussing with him. He cleared up unnecessary drama quickly and professionally. Tough class, but great teacher.

Id only recommend taking this class if youre already a tax professional. This is because his class consist of him reading off hundreds on power points slides as people blankly stare at him. His test are ridiculously hard and the study material he provides is everything is free game so preparing for 72% of your grade is nearly impossible.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This is not an easy class and Dr Clements does his best to simplify the material. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. Attendance is not mandatory, but even though his lectures are sometimes boring I advice you to show up because a lot of the stuff he discusses will be on the exam. Exams are open book. No cumulative final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: You are graded on 4 multiple choice tests, a tax return & research project (groups of 2-3), and 10 quizzes on connect. A lot of people do very well on the project. I think he grades the projects on effort rather than accuracy. ALL TESTS ARE OPEN BOOK AND NOTE. You can use the online book on tests. He provides notes from the textbook on D2L.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: 4 Test, quizz averaged and a tax project but not bad at all. He will let you to a textbook for the test, I dont like his teaching but love him as a professor.
Nice professor. Lectures are boring sometimes but whatever he teaches show up in the exam. Final exam is not comprehensive. Overall, its a good prof and class. I would take him again.

The class is tough itself and you need to work extra hard if you want an A. He gives you lectures to help you fully prepared for tests. There are 2 tests, a final and 10 quizzes. He is sweet, caring and funny. If you have any questions, do not hesitate to ask him.

I have never in my life studied this much. He gives way to many practice problems. You will easily spend 40+ hours trying to memorize stuff for his test. He does not curve exams. Four exams. 10 quizzes. A ton of connect HW. Be prepared to be entirely consumed with 100s of word problems. If he could narrow the problems more, he could be a great

Lots of quizzes and tests. Not great on the admin side - slow to grade and errors in notes/tests but very generous in curves and bonus quizzes. Sometimes zips through class notes quickly so be sure to speak up if you have questions. Has a lot of real life knowledge to share. Caring and wants students to succeed. Recommend attending every class.

Dr. Clements is really laid back & sweet and gives you every chance to make that A. Study guides, bonus quizzes done on D2L from home for extra credit, and his class outlines are so helpful. I did every problem on the recommended homework, went over every study guide and took extra notes on top of his already great outline in class and did well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Straight forward and only will lecture on information that will appear on the exams. Will not waste time with irrelevant information. Study hard, but he is a great person and a great teacher.

Lectures are  engaging for the subject matter and he seems nice; however, he never responds to email.  Also, he frequently has wrong answers coded on study sheets, quizzes & exams -- this is SO frustrating and will affect your grade if someone in class doesn't catch it.  I think he means well but the # of errors made this class a headache.

Dr. Clements is an excellent professor! He explained the material very well while we were in class and gave us study guides that helped prepare for exams. The tests were all multiple choice. I recommend taking him.

He is a fair professor and that's all you can ask for in any Intermediate Accounting class. It's a very hard class, but if you put the time in, you won't have any problem getting an A. Professor Clements gives you everything you need for the exams and usually only has one or two tricky (but not impossible) questions.

very nice & understanding, took him for a 4 week class & he even moved the test back a day because half of the class was taking another 4 week class that had a test on the same day. 3 test and learnsmart, do the practice exams he post to connect they are very similar to the test problems, he does curve, but will not post grades until they are due

Clements is a nice guy, but boy does he love to hear himself talk. His lectures were redundant and did not cover much of book. However, his exams only had book questions. Good luck reading 200 pages of a textbook! The only godsend is that exams are open-note, open book and most are take-home.
He is a really nice guy and presents the material pretty well.  The only issue I had was that he often seemed ambiguous about when stuff would be graded.

Mr. Clements is a great teacher. It's an easy class, just make sure you go and listen. Homework every week 10 problems, tests are easy if you pay attention in class. He's pretty funny and just all around a good teacher! Highly recommended.

Teaches well, doesn't reply to emails, not active on D2L. Fair grading 40% highest exam score any of the 3 exams, 1 financial analysis 10% of grade (very easy). Exam question can be tricky but not professor's fault. Accting has a lot of gray areas. He tries to make exams fair.
Class is moderately difficult. He did a good job at explaining this material but makes the test tricky on purpose. take someone else.

Professor Clements is overall pretty good professor. He brings a lot of real world examples into his lecture, which helps a lot. Very nice and Funny guy. He genuinely cares about his students. I would take him again. Like most 2100 classes there are 2 test and a final. Online quizzes and homework as well.

I am in his class right now for ACCT 2100. He might be good at teaching upper level accounting classes, but he does not know how to explain on a lower level. Don't take him if it's a low level accounting. He does care about his students though,
Very knowledgeable. He definitely knows his stuff and is very clear in his lectures. He wants you to do good and is very helpful. I highly recommend taking his class.

Dr. Clements is a very nice guy, but he goes on a lot of tangents and has a bit of a monotone voice. However, the class is certainly worth taking and he is one of the best accounting professors at Kennesaw. He has tons of credentials and knows what he is talking about.  He teaches accounting from a practical perspective. Recommended.

Clements was knowledgeable but sometimes had a hard time getting his point across. He repeats himself a lot, and it usually makes for a boring class. He jokes and that helps. I was surprised by the midterm but ready for the final. Study. He allows a cheat sheet for exams. Accessible and helpful. Group project and paper were very easy.
Teaches from experience.  Took as a December mester course and didn't need the book.  Tests are easy if you understand the material and have basic logic.  Highly recommended.
Very good teacher. Extremely knowledgeable, uses real world experiences to convey ideas and meaning. Very experienced; has MBA, JD, PHD, and CPA. Take his class if you can!
You need read book
easy-going and friendly, good sense of humor

Not very organized or well-prepared for class.Never received a grade until the final one. Felt as if he assumed a base of accounting knowledge that I and most of my colleagues did not have.I did well but found the class to be neither challenging nor interesting. To get ACCT8000 under you belt with a good grade for minimal pain, take him
This professor is very nice, very repetitive, but easy. I believe the only thing required all semester is to take 3 tests.

Prof is highly educated and has a lot of "real world" experience so he relates accounting principles to current events.  He grades pretty easy on the group work and we never stayed the entire class time.
No Comments
Very good teacher... stressless class
Great teacher---easy to understand
